caption: Another Paris icon worth the hype. My fiancé and I came here after our engagement and the bartenders took great care of us. The other pub goers are friendly. No music in the bar is a great touch - really helps breed conversation with the other patrons. Great American bourbons to select from! Definitely a must visit in Paris.

What a unique place! I'd been here with friends and I totally enjoyed the vibes. It's one of the oldest bars in Europe. The waiters are quite warm and helpful. The only thing you can order to eat here are hotdogs. The drinks are on the expensive side, but worth a try. Also, their famous drink is Bloody Mary(order only if you haven't had tomato soup before, because the taste is literally like that). The other drinks are pretty good. You can also look around in the restaurant to find some old items of importance from the USA.

A must-visit for any cocktail lover. Iconic in its own right, but bring a large group to make the most of your evening!  We purposely planned dinner around going out for a drink after at Harry’s Bar and we’re so pleased we did.  Visited on a Saturday evening at 10:30 and there was a short queue to enter but the member of staff who kept checking on us was very communicative about wait times and what to expect.  Inside is a buzzy vibe with no music - strange at first, but the general chatter should be enough to provide the vibe.  As a couple, we felt that bringing a larger group might be more fun! Plus that also gives you the opportunity to try more cocktails.  We ordered the French 75 and a Peat Manhattan, both very well-made and so good BUT it was hard to decide which cocktail to order since they all looked so delicious.  Will definitely need to go back and work our way down the menu!

The legendary Harry's New York Bar did not disappoint.  If the walls could speak I'm sure they would have legendary stories to tell about this place, but the most impressive thing for me was the bartender Dante.  On his own, he easily dealt with the entire bar, making drinks with style, whilst entertaining conversion with guests. Incredibly impressive  The Merci Guillaume was delicious as well.  Merci Dante

Went one quiet weekday afternoon to try and French 75 it was spectacular and had other cocktails that were bang on, the best we've had. Hot dog snack, chatted with the bartender about decor and history and it was such a great experience. A Paris highlight for us for sure!

We made the mistake of going at about 5:00 PM so it was very busy and we had to wait quite a while for a table. We didn’t mind, but if you want to get in and out more quickly, maybe go a bit earlier in the day. The atmosphere was so fun and quirky, and the drinks were great. I tried the Bloody Mary & the French 75 and loved both. They even have non-alcoholic cocktail options which I thought was great.

This is one of the coolest places in the world.  The bartenders wear lab coats because well, they are like scientists.  I kept going back during my visit to Paris, even though it wasn't the most convenient Metro ride from my hotel.  One visit I met two New Zealanders and two Australians.  The next time I met a young man from Denmark who said he had played tennis against Janek Sinner when they were younger.  The barmen are expert mixologists.  They make a mean very dry martini with a twist.  The hot dogs are to die for.  Excellent vibe amazing decor.  Go here!
The real McCoy- perfect cocktails. These guys don’t play around. This is a proper cocktail bar.

This is the birthplace of Bloody Mary! Nice cozy bar with the basement that offers jazz play Wednesday to Saturday and sometimes with comedy too. I like that all waiter has white lab-style uniform, looks cool. Ofc we tried their Bloody Mary, it is for sure decent but I cannot judge the difference, maybe I am not the Bloody Mary expert.
A perfect bar to get cocktails where they were created. Mixed so well, and the place is buzzing with atmosphere.
Legendary place with good atmosphere. Hemingway, Bogart and Rita Hayworth enjoyed also there. The birthplace of my favorite Bloody Mary.
They invented the bloody Mary drinks are top-notch bartenders are great.You can even feed the mice under the bar first for me lol
An iconic place! Stopped in after plenty of recommendations. We had to order the French 75s. THE BEST I’ve ever had!! The bar tender was a great host. You won’t regret it :)
Lovely atmosphere. Burgundy velvet downstairs. Hemingway approved. Some of my favorite cocktails were invented here so had to see for myself. Will be back.

We found this gem on our last night in Paris and were so glad we did! Amazing cocktails with great staff looking after us, not to mention the famous hot dogs! We had to have a second round with our next drink they were so good. My partner is still raving about his Bloody Mary being the best he has ever had. The iconic French 45 was also just delicious. Highly recommend as a pre-dinner or late night spot for a drink.
Really nice place for a few cocktails. Sat at the bar and watched the men at work - such a skill. OK, it’s in the pricey side but I think it was worth it.
An absolute gem! Best cocktails in the city, hands down. The staff are amazing. Love the jazzy vibes and the unexpected delight of their hot dogs. A must-visit!

Honestly, this is one of the best places in Paris. Leaving the cold damp dark streets of Paris on a November night to head down the narrow winding wooden staircase that leads to their basement brought me to a little piece of jazz heaven. Go early and stay late. Embrace your new role as an International Bar Fly. Enjoy the jazz artistry you will experience there.

Iconic bar in Paris. Incredible atmosphere, feels like you are in New York with a French twist. Service was prompt and very friendly, warm and homey atmosphere like TV show Cheers. They make you feel like you have always belonged there.

I would definitely give it more than 5 stars if it had.  The feeling is indescribable when you enter this beautiful bar. The feeling as if you entered a bar a hundred years ago. Excellent decorations, excellent quality of drinks, excellent staff attitude. Definitely, if someone asks me for the address of a good bar in Paris, this is the first place. If I come to Paris again, I will definitely visit here. It is recommended

Harry’s New York Bar is an absolute Paris classic. A great cocktail bar and the oldest cocktail bar in Europe. This is not a place for wine, but if you like mixed drinks you should love this place. Very lively atmosphere and a great place to meet people. Also be sure to have a Red Hot which is a great hot dog.

Made Harry's a must visit in Paris for the bar's history. As a Bloody Mary purist, I had to come to where it was created. The atmosphere, vibe, decorations, and service from the bar are tops. The cocktails are superb and have to say, anyone that comes to Paris should come to visit Harry's and enjoy great libations, great bartenders and great history!
Definitely worth a visit- Fantastic cocktails!
Loved the vibes here!! It's cozy and fun and cool. Servers are also so nice and welcoming. Nothing to say about the drinks, they are just amazing. Would def recommend.

A cocktail bar with an amazing rich history, and the birthplace if many classics. Incredible to take a part in it! Very knowledgeable staff and lots of interesting cocktails. The menu changes often. They can also make something for you even if it's not on the current menu so don't be shy to ask! Really recommend the Granny Smith. Can get pretty crowded though and the service is slow.

Absolutely incredible bar. Legendary place. They open up pretty early so if you don't want to wait in line you can stop by for a mid-day drink. The drinks are all incredible. They have a list of drinks invented in that bar and my favorite was the french 75. Also recommend trying their sidecar and tequila drinks

This bar is awesome! Especially if you are a fan of Hemingway and the Lost Generation, this is one of his old haunts and a haven for expats in Paris. You always get to see and meet new people from around the world and the vibe is so on point for imagining you're there with the Lost Generation having philosophical discussions and pontificating about the world. Yes the drinks are a bit expensive, (you are in Paris after all, and across from the opera) but it is a famous bar with major historical and literary significance so definitely worth it. This bar is also known for having created many cocktails including the French 75 (by some regarded as the first cocktail), the Bloody Mary, and the Sidecar.

Harry’s bar Claim’s to be Europe’s oldest bar and inventor of the Bloody Mary, this place is a must if you want to make a pilgrimage to drink this holy beverage that has saved me on many occasions the following morning after a big night out. we stopped to take a break after a lot of walking and they have a restroom.  Seating Inside seating is comfy, intimate with high dealings and small tables. Can sit groups of 2 or 4.  Food I ordered two tasty hotdogs served with a side of tomato sauce, mustard and pickle relish. That’s the only food they offer on the menu and it hit the spot, we came to drink and appreciated the hotdogs as a snack.  Drinks The Bloody Mary is a must if you are a fan and I ordered one and it didn’t disappoint. Experienced mixologists on hand brought me the Trinidad sour was was great although without the egg foam as they are usually made in Australia nevertheless it was good and interesting to drink it without it. The cocktails on the menu have some interesting flavour combinations I’ve never seen together before.  10/10 I will come back and drink the cocktails all over again.

This old style cocktail bar is worth a visit for ex-pats. My partner was delighted with the Old Fashioned, as well as their other signature drinks. I had the hot dog, which was surprisingly really great. The bartender on staff was alone, and pretty busy, but still very talkative and welcoming. You could tell he really enjoys his job. The decor is really neat with a bunch of pennants and wood accents. I highly recommend a visit.

Drinks were tasty but the service was horrible. If you are two women getting drinks forget you exist. The servers are sexist and would serve the men first (even if you came before them and will get your drinks after 30 mins) What a disgusting experience. It’s 2025, get with it.

This is our favorite bar in Paris and we’ve been coming here regularly again and again. The growing popularity has not done wonders for our sobriety… as we’ve found ourselves having to get here earlier and earlier just to get in. We now have to get our Harry’s bar fix on Mondays at 1pm. I’m giving a bad review because i’m trying to get your attention… the hot dog supply is incredibly unreliable and in our opinion that’s unacceptable. The cocktails are spectacular, the cocktails+hot dog experience is what keeps us coming back. So please, please fix your supply chain and the review will go back to 10 stars out of 5 ❤️
Wonderful intimate spot for jazz and delicious cocktails. Premium service. And the best hotdog I’ve ever had!

Be prepared to wait for your drink if it is busy, but that is honestly part of the charm for me.  The bar is amazing, the drinks are amazing(particularly the bloody and the coronation), the history is amazing, I could go on.  From Hemingway to Gershwin, this place is full of amazing cultural history.  If you can, see it.

Very popular tourist spot. Good drinks and friendly service, but can be difficult to find wait staff when needed because of the crowds. We went and listened to some live jazz on a Friday evening and LOVED that. The music was wonderful.

The bar looks great, old money and cosy/rustic. If we saw the waiters, they were nice, but they rarely passed us by. The drinks are drinks you mostly never have seen before, so only go if you know a few things about mixology and which liqueur tastes like what. The drinks are really expensive, around the 20€ mark for a normal sized cocktail or longdrink. Was an experience, wouldn't recommend it.

Really enjoyed this American style bar in Paris. The pennants on the wall are pretty cool, I couldn’t think of a single university they were missing! The drinks were excellent. I had an old fashioned that was great. Service is high quality. We had a table. Only thing I missed out on was a classic hotdog, next time- I would come back again for sure

This is a FIVE Star establishment.  The cocktails are divine.  That is what they focus on.  The hotdogs, with a lovely drizzle of Dijon Mustard on a brioche bun are very flavorful and yummy!  Great job to the team here!  BTW - good enough to go twice in a trip!

Full of history and unique place in Paris. But rather lacking in atmosphere during the day. Specialises in cocktails and spirits with just a couple of beers on tap. A New York bar favoured by visiting Americans. Rather expensive.
